newsitem.title: USA: CSCE coffee ends dull session mainly weaker.
newsitem.headline: CSCE coffee ends dull session mainly weaker.

text.p: CSCE coffee futures finished mainly weaker in thin, directionless dealings on Tuesday, pressured by light speculative selling, traders said.
A lack of fresh fundamental input contributed to today's sluggish tone, they said, with local activity on both sides of the market confining prices to a narrow range.

May closed down 0.65 cent per lb, at 178.75 cents, after trading from 180.80 to 176.00. Second-month July settled 0.55 cent weaker, at 164.50 cents, while the back months finished 1.90 lower to 3.50 higher.
The closely watched May/July switch, which widened to around 15.00 cents during the session, ended at 14.25 cents, down slightly from 14.35 cents at the close Monday.
Some traders said May's recent struggle to close over the 180.00-cent level could lead to further losses in the near-term.
"In the short-term, I think the market will go lower simply because it's not going up," one dealer said.
Technically, traders pegged May support at 175.00 cents, then 172.00-171.00 cents. Resistance was seen at 183.00-183.50, followed by 185.00.
Volume was light, at an estimated 5,250 lots, down from Monday's official tally of 6,444 lots.
After Tuesday's close, CSCE reported certified coffee stocks were off 500 60-kg bags, to 81,828 bags as of April 7. There were no bags pending grading, the exchange said.
